meanings.definition: An outline representing or bounding the shape or form of something.
meanings.sent1: The artist carefully followed the contours of the mountain in his painting.
meanings.sent2: The hiker studied the contours of the landscape before planning her route.
meanings.sent3: The child traced the contours of the dinosaur toy with fascination.
meanings.sent4: Her smile followed the contours of her face, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The detective used the contours of the footprint to track the suspect.

meanings.definition: A line on a map joining points of equal elevation.
meanings.sent1: The map displayed the contours of the land with different colors for elevation.
meanings.sent2: The hiker relied on the contours on the map to navigate the mountain terrain.
meanings.sent3: The students giggled as they tried to draw the contours of the hills accurately.
meanings.sent4: The contours on the map resembled waves of a colorful ocean.
meanings.sent5: The contours on the map made it easier for the pilot to plan the flight path.
